channel.title: A bit of help
channel.description: When repartitioning my drive, my laptop battery popped out (it was loose, cause I dropped it the lock just cracked) Now I can't do anything. The crcdisk.sys module cannot load on Windows. I can't install linux, it says the partition is corrupt. Help pls?

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Download a Knoppix livecd, pop it in, and run ‘testdisk’. Use some common sense and testdisk should fix the partition tables (worked for me when I fucked up in the middle of a partition)

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“voiD dev, post:11, topic:157923”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=215288.msg1878978#msg1878978 date=1194862813]
Illegally download a copy of Vista, and install it using your serial number, that should be legal and free.
[/quote]
Thats what I was thinking. But then again, legality goes only some way. =)
Now I just need to purchase a DVD big enough.[/quote]

As far as I know, it is legal to download software if you have bought it.

You can try phoning up Microsoft, see if they’ll be sympathetic.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It burns to a regular sized DVD.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @voiD_dev voiD dev
item.description:
@voiD_dev wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Illegally download a copy of Vista, and install it using your serial number, that should be legal and free.

Thats what I was thinking. But then again, legality goes only some way. =)
Now I just need to purchase a DVD big enough.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Illegally download a copy of Vista, and install it using your serial number, that should be legal and free.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The exact same thing happened to me, although i do backup my files (personal music and shit like that) every week so, basically i just deleted the corrupt partition and recreated it (did not format it (i let windows do that)).

But i had already bought Vista seperate (for times like this :rolleyes:).

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @voiD_dev voiD dev
item.description:
@voiD_dev wrote:

VAIO, are kinda cheap. I paid for my Vista and the support guy just said oh take some backup cds with a VAIO utility. When I explained to him that my partition is corrupt, he told me that it would be at least $300 for the CD. The warranty doesn’t cover the software, just hardware. Unless I drop my computer or fry my hard-drive and then tell them that there has been a sabotage or an accident of some sort. They might fix that.
Who was the person who actually though of the dvd files to be put on a partition?

I can load up a live CD since it doesn’t use any partitions, but installing is another issue. I could somehow try and use that recovery Vista partition. It is currently the only partition that works.

Or I can take a big risk and delete the NFTS partition, and then recreate it. But if this happens, there is no way I can reload my Vista without any 3rd party software.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What Greeny said^, AND I believe Vista uses some slightly different version of NTFS, which probably is not supported by most of the 3rd party partition recovery tools. You can try contacting VAIO and get them to send you an actual CD, or you can just install ubuntu on your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

If they’re corrupt then there’s no way of retrieving data, apart from perhaps one of these 3rd party partition recovery tools, however I don’t know how reliable they.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @voiD_dev voiD dev
item.description:
@voiD_dev wrote:

I can’t the partition is corrupt, it cannot be read.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Try loading a live CD accessing those partitions and taking anything you need off them that way.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @voiD_dev voiD dev
item.description:
@voiD_dev wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:157923”]Ouch.

Sounds like a full reformat of the entire drive for you my friend.[/quote]
Eh, the vista binaries are stored on one partition. Default by VAIO. Is there a way I can load that on a dvd?
I can’t launch a full format via that partition =(

I might have to contact VAIO unless I get some kind of help.

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ouch.

Sounds like a full reformat of the entire drive for you my friend.

Read full topic
